snippet: New claims for unemployment benefits in the United States edged down last week, while the United States trade deficit widened in March, the government reported.
abstract: Labor department reports that initial claims for unemployment benefits fell by 1,000 in the first week of May; report eases concerns that the labor market was deteriorating after surprisingly weak employment growth in April; trade gap widened 14.1 percent to $51.8 billion in March as the surge in imports swamped a rise in exports.
lead_paragraph: New claims for unemployment benefits in the United States edged down last week, while the United States trade deficit widened in March, the government reported.

headline.seo: U.S. Jobless Claims Fall; Trade Deficit Widens
headline.main: Dip in Jobless Claims Eases Worries Over Hiring
headline.print_headline: Dip in Jobless Claims Eases Worries Over Hiring
